_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



FXI, Inc.

Portland, OR



FXI, Inc., is committed to operating and maintaining its facilities and processes in a safe and responsible manner, which provides safe conditions for Company employees, the surrounding community and the environment. 



Our Portland facility manufactures flexible polyurethane (PU) foam products for the furniture, bedding and carpet underlayment industries.  One of the major chemical ingredients used in the PU foam manufacturing process is Toluene diisocyanate (mixed isomers) (TDI), CAS #  26471-62-5. Our TDI inventory is maintained above 10,000 lbs.  In accordance with the provisions of 40 CFR Part 68 (Chemical Accident Prevention Regulations), the worst case scenario was defined as the rupture of, and the immediate spillage of, the contents of a TDI railcar into an earthern berm containment area.  The impact of this spill was evaluated using the ALOHA model and resulted in no public receptors within the radius to the endpoint.  The release rate, calculated by the ALOHA model, was 0.0278 lbs./min.  



This facility has an OSHA HAZWOPER trained Hazmat Team, which will provide initial response to any and all spills, despite the substance or .  



This facility also has contracted professional emergency responders as back-up.  If required, the assistance of the Portland fire department Hazmat Team will be requested. 



This facility's Emergency Response Plan has been coordinated with the LEPC, local fire department, the local fire department Hazmat Commander, and local police department.  



All employees responsible for the handling and control of hazardous substances are provided initial and refresher training in proper procedures as required by the USEPA, OSHA and DOT regulatory requirements.



There have been no accidental releases involving TDI (mixed isomers) which require reporting in the five-year accident history per the requirements of 40 CFR 68.42(a).
